intro: Vitex vansteenisii, commonly known as the Van Steenis chaste tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, clustered purple or blue flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in secondary forests and along stream banks. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature.
